Well, I'm not quite sure if it is bug or standard HTML behaviour but I'v problem with handling international (czech) characters in HTML form (action type GET) in JSP. There is example: <%@ page language="java" contentType="text/html; charset=UTF-8" %> <%@page pageEncoding="UTF-8"%> UTF-8 Encoding

Text from JSP page (which is ASCII encoded).

Text obtained from parameter is:

<% request.setCharacterEncoding("UTF-8"); String param = request.getParameter("anyText"); out.println(param); %> When I try sets czech (acute) characters, thats not fit into ISO8859-1 subset, these characters are not handled correctly. It looks like form text is correctly encoded to UTF-8 (see URI string), but decoded as ISO8859-1. But when I change method='post' in form tag, everything works OK.
